Description: Upper body fragment of Attic black-figured pottery closed vase; reserved inside. Outside: male hand seeming to hold a large kantharos to left, towards a female figure who holds out her himation; behind them, vines; added white (no longer preserved) for the arm and hand of the female; red or white on her garment. Dionysos and Ariadne?
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 94 no. 328 pl. 70)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1988)
